page.title: 08THE FLYOVER
page.content: Much of Greenford is becoming a concrete jungle and in an effort to take the vast amount of traffic from London to Oxford away from our local army of traffic a flyover was built. In the process four subways were constructed to allow people who are pedestrians to cross from one side of Greenford to the other like a small rickety bridge across a river, so allowing communication between tribes of people on either side of the A40. The GLC have tried to spice up the subways by incorporating tile mosaics made by local schools. Much graffiti has spread over the walls. However some of it is good like FRESH and MERLIN. People are intimidated by the sight of the massive structure which in the night is supposed to be a haven for vandals, thieves and vagabonds. It is however here to stay.
